trans-unit.source: Exports service description information into metadata.

Metadata export is the process of describing service endpoints and projecting them into a parallel, standardized representation (typically, but not necessarily XML) that applications can access to implement a client that uses the service.

To export metadata from <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint?displayProperty=fullName> objects, use an implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> abstract class.

A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> implementation generates metadata that is encapsulated in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet?displayProperty=fullName> instance.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> class provides a framework for generating policy expressions that describe the capabilities and requirements of an endpoint binding and its associated operations, messages and faults.
These policy expressions are captured in a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext?displayProperty=fullName> instance.
A <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> implementation can then attach these policy expressions to the metadata it generates.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> calls into each <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement?displayProperty=fullName> that implements the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyExportExtension?displayProperty=fullName> interface in the binding of a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> when generating a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext> object for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> implementation to use.

You can export new policy assertions by implementing the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IPolicyExportExtension> interface on your custom implementations of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement?displayProperty=fullName> type.

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter?displayProperty=fullName> type is the implementation of the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> class included with [!INCLUDE[indigo1](~/includes/indigo1-md.md)].
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> type generates WSDL metadata with attached policy expressions.

To export custom WSDL metadata or WSDL extensions for endpoint behaviors, contract behaviors or binding elements in a service endpoint, you can implement the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.IWsdlExportExtension?displayProperty=fullName> interface.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.WsdlExporter> type calls into parts of a service endpoint that implement this interface when generating the WSDL document from that endpoint.
Gets a collection of errors that occurred during metadata export.
This property is populated with errors that occurred during the metadata export process.
Users of derived classes should check the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.Errors%2A> property prior to using the exported metadata.
The export errors that occurred.
When overridden in a derived class, exports a contract description into metadata.
Override and implement <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.ExportContract%2A> to convert a contract description into metadata.
The contract to export.
When overridden in a derived class, converts an endpoint into metadata.
Override and implement <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.ExportEndpoint%2A> to convert a contract description into metadata.
The endpoint to convert.
Converts policy assertions into a <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyConversionContext"></xref> object.
The endpoint from which to extract policy assertions.
An object that contains policy assertion information for the endpoint.
The policy assertions can then be embedded in a metadata document.

When overridden in a derived class, returns the metadata generated by a call to either <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.ExportContract(System.ServiceModel.Description.ContractDescription)"></xref>, <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.ExportEndpoint(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint)"></xref>, or <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.ExportPolicy(System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint)"></xref>.
Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.GetGeneratedMetadata%2A> method to retrieve the metadata generated from earlier calls.
Check the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter.Errors%2A> property prior to retrieving the metadata to ensure that you have the metadata you want.
An enumerable collection of <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection"></xref> objects that contain the exported metadata.
Specifies the version of WS-Policy specification being used.
The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyVersion> class contains the namespace for the version of WS-Policy the metadata exporter uses.
WS-Policy 1.2 and 1.5 are currently supported.
A <xref href="System.ServiceModel.Description.PolicyVersion"></xref> instance.
Gets a dictionary of objects used in the export of metadata.
Use the `State` property to pass a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExporter> state data required to successfully export endpoints or contracts.
A dictionary of objects used by the importer to export contracts and endpoints.
